definitions.text:
1. Cheerful readiness; promptness. It expresses more than willingness. We admire the forwardness of christians in propagating the gospel.
2. Eagerness; ardor. It is sometimes difficult to restrain the forwardness of youth.
3. Boldness; confidence; assurance; want of due reserve modesty. In France it is usual to bring children into company, and cherish in them, from their infancy, kind of forwardness and assurance.
4. state of advance beyond the usual degree; as the forwardness of spring of corn.
